summary: Climate change is expected to affect financial markets over time. For example, transitioning to a low-carbon economy could reduce the financial performance of companies that emit greenhouse gases. This could pose risks for retirement plans invested in such companies—including the Thrift Savings Plan for federal workers. Some retirement plans in other countries have assessed climate change-related risks and taken steps to address and disclose them...
title: Retirement Savings: Federal Workers' Portfolios Should Be Evaluated For Possible Financial Risks Related to Climate Change
